intro: Johnsonia pubescens var. drummondii, commonly known as the Drummond's Johnsonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences, typically blooming during the summer months. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a rugged appearance, adapted to its arid and semi-arid habitats. Johnsonia pubescens var. drummondii is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
